Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பண்புடையார்ப் பட்டுண்டு உலகம் அதுஇன்றேல்மண்புக்கு மாய்வது மன்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The world abides; for 'worthy' men its weight sustain. Were it not so, 'twould fall to dust again.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A group of 'Panbudaiyar' (courteous/worthy people) are shown engaged in acts of kindness and harmonious interaction, forming a strong, interconnected web.
Layered_Composition.Midground: This web of good character transforms into a metaphysical foundation or net that literally holds the world ('Ulagam') together, preventing it from crumbling.
Layered_Composition.Background: The Earth is depicted as a fragile sphere that would otherwise disintegrate into dust ('Manpukku Maaivadhu') if not for the sustaining power of these worthy individuals.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A cosmic representation of the idea that the existence and stability of the world are dependent on the presence and actions of people with good character.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The web of light connecting the worthy people. The world being held together by this web is the central metaphor. The crumbling dust represents the alternative.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Profound, foundational, cosmic, a sense of immense responsibility.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The web of character glows with a powerful, life-sustaining golden light. The Earth itself is a vibrant blue and green, but the space around it is dark, emphasizing its fragility. The crumbling dust is dark and lifeless.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Epic cosmic wide shot, showing the earth being sustained by the network of virtue.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, cosmic art style, with photorealistic planetary textures and ethereal light effects for the web.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: The primary light source is the glowing web of virtue itself, illuminating the Earth.

Cultural_Anchors: The fragility of the world order

Negative_Prompt: people fighting, a broken web, a destroyed earth, modern people, text artifacts, cartoonish.
